headline: Positive Innovation
pros:
This review is explicitly for Swiggy LABS, which is the Innovation-centric ("loonshot") of the broader organization. I have been at Swiggy Labs for more than 2 years, and it has been a motivating, learning, and positive experience.

At Labs, we envisaged-researched-worked and prototyped on complex, unconventional, and radical ideas. 

With whole free hand given to come with out-of-the-box ideas, for an innovative thinker, there are no significant limits (given the ideas are relevant of course!) 

The culture is very open and motivating and special focus is given to individual growth. We did have regular workshops around mental models, radical candor, and "Art of Thinking Clearly" / thinking biases. 

The projects we worked on, also comprised of a wide horizontal range. For example, in tech - Drones, Self-Checkout system, Augmented Reality, Automatic food machines, OpenCV based object recognition and lots which span a wide range of tech. So we have to keep learning and be on toes. 

The leadership and organisation is also strong and simplified. The communication of ideas is clear and objective. Probably credit goes to the workshops as well. 

It has been a great experience. One gets to feel the pace of working in a start-up, though in a more organized manner. 

Recommended for all the techies/non-techies looking to expand their expertise not only in their domain but in overall conduct.

And, Swiggy pays well.
cons: By definition as we work on radical ideas, some or many of them are bound to fail and get rejected. Fail fast (and learn) is one of the key themes through pods. So one shall keep an unbiased (without lot of emotions) approach towards the pitching and execution of an idea, and be ready for the possibility that it may or may not hit the scale, even though there would be great learning in the process.

headline: Rated 1 as there is no lower rating. Pathetic work culture
pros:
1. Challenging problems to solve.
2. You get to learn a lot of different technologies.
3. You learn to take ownership of a big scale project impacting millions of users.
cons:
1. There is no work life balance. Even if you are on leave, the manager will shamelessly point to others that they can call you since you are the only POC of a particular service.
2. No regard for employees mental health. Your manager is not your manager, he is a Swiggy's bouncer assigned to you to make sure you work like a donkey and nothing less.
3. You spend half your day in context switching. If a team has 8 people, they will literally be working on 5-7 projects at a time. Also, because of the overlap of ownership, you will be working on something and will immediately be called upon to look at a production issue, which by nature takes a higher priority than the work you had at hand. This ensures that you can get little to no software development done during office hours and have to burn the midnight oil. 
4. Heavily underemployed. For God's sake, if you don't have enough employees, don't take up so many projects.

My review here is to clarify the kind of work at SwiggyLabs and Labs only. Work at Swiggy is much different - You might have to go through other reviews for that.

Labs might seem lucrative during the hiring process( You're just shown the positive sides of working here ) and in the initial stages of your journey here. Only after 3-4 months after working here you'll understand the reality.

It was tough for me and everyone in Engg. to justify the work we've done here for the past 1+ years in the interviews for the next jobs. Do not want any other engineer to face the same.

And yes, almost every engineer started looking out after completion of their 1 year. The only reason you'd want to wait a year is to save yourself the joining bonus and to vest the esops.

# There isn't any quality work for a software engineer.

# Work is repetitive ( You keep creating similar products throughout your time here). Nothing new to learn on the job.

# All the work is PoCs and MVPs. So, If you are a software engineer with a decent experience and want to take your skills to the next level, This isn't the right place for you.

# There is no leadership in Tech. No one to guide the Tech Team. Hence, nothing new to learn.

# No recognition for your work in software because there is no Tech Lead or anyone who'd understand Tech in depth.

# You are forced to write bad code to role out the products soon. All the code you write here is *supposed to be scrappable* because you don't have to take it to scale.

# Mostly focussed on Hardware products.

# Too much time( more than a year ) wasted on figuring out the kind of work labs engineers are supposed to do. Still have no clarity on it

# Too much free time on your hands (more than 60% of your time during working hours).

TLDR; could be a good opportunity for freshers. Waste of time for anyone with more than 2 years of experience

Mismanagement is seen at every step in the journey of interviewing to getting the final offer. HR is probably the only team which resorts to insipid platitudes about "better than industry average" when asked about their incompetence. Probably a result of hiring HR folks from the IT industry where, sadly,  employees are treated no better than sheep. headline: Mess in Devops
pros:
Company is doing good and the tech team under the new director of engineering is heading in the right direction. His vision is great and his energy to get things done is enormous. 
The tech team is young and very friendly , at least at the mid senior level.
cons:
Unfortunately the Devops team is not under the umbrella of the new director of engineering and still resides under the CTO. The CTO is really really immature both tech wise and maturity wise. The initial Devops team was great and self sustaining but when a new VP joined in it went totally haywire. The CTO did nothing but add fuel to the fire. To understand the impact, imagine a team of 14 devops engineers working for an Unicorn startup in India , have all left and the company is trying desperately to hire new ones. There was a quick succession of top devops managers leaving the company too. 
Its impossible to talk maturely or rollout new ideas under them.

Perk wise the company is very much behind even compared to new startups like CureFit, Instamojo, etc. 
The quality of food is sub optimal and you need to pay for it.
There is a lot lot of politics at the VP and higher management level.  New ideas get stuck there and keeps going round and round as things dont move smoothly at the  higher level. So basically you join with the energy of working for a startup and getting new things done but face the politics of MNC's and feel frustrated. Also it comes to the individual , that at the end of the day they did not deliver.

headline: Employee Friendly Company
pros:
There has been a lot of reviews on Swiggy and its employee relationship. I am not sure how it is all across the company but from Technology team perspective, it does the right thing.

I love working at Swiggy and some of the best folks in the Industry. If you are passionate about either Technology or  Food Industry, Swiggy is the place to work for.

Company is performing rounds of One-on-One with the CEO and VP HR. Even after all these, some people feel they are not able to share the concern with right folks? If CEO and VP HR are not the right folks then who else could be the right folks in a company?

In August 2015, Swiggy did aggressive hiring and a bunch of folks without any passion and looking only for Money got into the company. When it is identified, the company have put them in PIP (with months of notice) or respective Appraisal bands and they ended up leaving and writing reviews on net. Once all these category people leave the company, Swiggy will turn to be one of the best places to work for.

To the Management - Folks, there are still a few such employees who are either bad in tech or non-passionate. It will be good if we can weed them off soon. It will improve the overall moral of the company.

Apart from all these, there has been a lot of reviews saying bad reviews are deleted on Glassdoor. Does glassdoor allows delete? Think before believing in those reviews.
cons:
Not everything is right with every Start-Up. Swiggy turned TWO years old and they have been successful in the struggling food industry. This was possible with reducing cost on every end including the Salary/Hike for employees and especially Tech.

I hope when the company achieves bigger and turns into undisputed leader, they will visit back into the Salaries and Hikes. Until then my passion for Tech and Food Industry will drive me.

Offer Letters have changed 5-6 months after you start working and you can't do anything about it, Variable component has so many loop holes to ensure no one gets them, the hike that you get either gets completely converted to Variable (which again you won't get) or is promised from October and not April (again a promise that won't be fulfilled). There are hardly any employees left who are not looking for some other opportunity and would simply leave as soon as they get the chance. 3-4 people sitting in an AC office believe they know how everything should work and will blame you if any of their ideas fail. Finance & HR is completely screwed up. Asking for Finance to do a payment on time is considered as a serious offence and you might even be shouted upon if you expect Finance to make payments even after 2-3 weeks have passed from the deadline. To them employees are nothing more than slaves who they are paying for. There are a lot of people who don't do well with too much power and that's what the entire top management of this company has become (including the CEO). Hopeless place to stay in or join.

headline: Well tuned Start-Up
pros:
Swiggy is a startup far apart from Other startups. The best thing at Swiggy is about stable business and its not just about customer acquisition (at any cost). 

Strong technical team:
The products and components built are so mature and has gone through a lot of thought process while designing and building them. When i joined this company, I was bit surprised to see such a mature platform in a short span.

Founders to employees, everyone is keen to solve the primary Motto - 'No Customer goes Hungry':
Just like any other startups, Swiggy has seen multiple Outages and its amazing to see folks jumping in to solve the problem. Swiggy has built a strong front-line folks and these guys jump in during all tough situations  and crack through. Not the least, the CTO himself is seen to be part of this front-line multiple times.

Aggressive towards market
Swiggy does not ride on offers but they grow by providing Quality service. 99% of the friends and relatives who had used the service were positive.

A great place to work, enjoy and learn things. If you compare this company with other best startups of 2015, definitely work-life balance is far better and a stable business roadmap.

CEO:
It was not surprising when Economic Times spoke about Swiggy's profitability plans (during Series-C funding). Definitely, the CEO has taken a stance to be more stable and is determined to run the business and not to dwindle like swiggy's competitors
cons:
Some pros turn cons at times.

Stable business:
Swiggy is not gonna payout like other startups. Increments and pay compensation are not going to be as aggressive. 

Tech Management:
The senior management (Leads, Manager, Director & CTO) has minimal people management experience and has lot to learn and perform. 

Non-tech teams Culture:
Swiggy may have to look into this aspect
